Reviews.Title: “Nice but way too hot!”
Reviews.Author: raedar
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned home from Toronto where we stayed at the BWPlus Roehampton. The hotel was one of the choices we were given for a wedding we were attending. I chose the BW plus because the price was good & it was closest to the wedding venue. We were able to walk over to the wedding from the hotel. The staff were very friendly & efficient when we checked in. We had no trouble finding the hotel from the directions they had given on their website. The room was clean & the bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately the room was unbearably hot. We arrived late in the afternoon so just had time for a little rest from the drive & then time to get ready for the wedding. The room was so hot it was very difficult getting ready. The bathroom is small so it was a bit of a struggle getting ready due to the size & the heat. I was soaked in sweat while trying to get dressed up. The room did have a window that opened so we opened it up & turned on the cooling system before we left for the wedding. When we returned from the wonderful wedding the room had not cooled down at all. If it hadn't been so late I would have called the front desk. It was next to impossible to sleep. I finally got a couple of hours sleep just out of sheer exhaustion but when I got up the pillow was soaked as was I. That was sleeping with no blankets on us. I ended up having a cool shower to try to cool off. Another couple that we were going to the wedding with had the same issue in their room too. If it wasn't for the heat it would have been a very pleasant stay. My husband & I had the breakfast buffet before we checked out & it was good.The choices were adequate. The fresh fruit was very good as were the croissants. The waitress was also very friendly & efficient. When we went to leave the car was returned to us very quickly. Overall it is a nice hotel for the price especially considering most hotel prices in Toronto. If it wasn't for the heat we would have been extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Locksley9
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto for a theatre excursion and stayed overnight at this property. The entire experience was top notch. The staff and service impeccable, the facility clean and well kept. We were in a king room with plenty of space, a large hd tv, an ipod dock in the clock radio, a small fridge and ample coffee and tea. The bathroom had a superb shower. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed a good nights sleep. The vallee parking very efficient. The breakfast was nicely set out and your choice of buffet, continental or menu. After we checked in and had settled into the room, the front desk called to see if everything was alright, a nice touch. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for one business night in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SabaOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: I had business for one day in the northern part of Toronto near Yonge street and this hotel was convenient by subway both from downtown station and then further north to worksite. The hotel was perfectly adequate for the price. I didn't eat in the hotel, because I arrived after 8 p.m. and it was closing at 9:00. It looked ordinary - perhaps better suited to a quick buffet breakfast; but I skipped it in the morning as well and ate closer to my work location. The room was clean and quiet, and check-in was friendly. For dinner there were adequate pub sand restaurants in walking distance in a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with management and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ValleyTravelers
Reviews.Content: We Stayed 3 nights in February, a Thursday, Friday, and Saturday. We several had other family members book rooms for one or two nights at the same time. It was very disappointing that after returning from a funeral that we were locked out of our room by management. They had cancelled our room keys and we were told there was damage in our room. The desk clerk said we had red wine stains on the duvets and they would be some charges, but we were to speak with the hotel owner in the morning. A long story short there were a few wine stain specks on the duvets that was our fault. We removed the duvet covers and cleaned them with soap and water and they were more than clean. I believe that they were trying to make extra money on us. We told them it was very unprofessional of the management to lock us out of our room and they said it was standard practice. 15 of us ate breakfast in the restaurant on the last morning. There was no butter no margarine for the toast, no forks on the table. For a buffet the service sucked. The next stay will not be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I only stayed one night”
Reviews.Author: BR613
Reviews.Content: Good points: Clean room; seemingly new, comfortable bed; my request for a quiet room was accommodated. Bad points: Dreadful, surly service when I checked in in the early evening, both front desk and doorman; when I returned to the hotel around 1 AM, my key card wouldnâ€™t work; when I brought it to the desk, I received a lecture from the night clerk on how to store key cards; I look old enough for the clerk to have assumed that this was not my first hotel stay; morning desk service was only marginally better. Besides the bed, the other furnishings looked worn. Location is not close to main attractions, but it served the purpose of my visit; entranceway is narrow, peculiarly located beside the hotel and almost invisible from the street; three Toronto friends had trouble finding it.

Reviews.Title: “Good For A One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: daphne7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family just for one night. Didn't know had to pay 14.00 for parking, the heat in the room didn't warm up the room but instead made a loud noise that was hard to sleep with, and the breakfast was dissapointing to say the least. There were also pistachio nut shells on the bathroom counter when we arrived, and some garbage on the floor around the beds. If I were to stay in a hotel in toronto again, I don't think I would pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location, great place for smokers”
Reviews.Author: sprigget
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at the Best Western. The hotel is convenient to local shops and restaurants. The staff are nice and accommodating. The linens are nice, and the beds are sleep-able. The rooms, while a good size, seem a bit run down. For example, the wallpaper was coming loose at several seems and there was a cigarette hole burned into the desk chair. I had requested a non-smoking room (reserved 6 weeks before my stay), and was, in fact, given a smoking room. I was told that there were no non-smoking rooms left in the establishment. A colleague I was traveling with is a heavy smoker and she expressed great appreciation for the opportunity to stay indoors and smoke in bed. For me, the main reason to stay in this hotel again is the convenience and the fact that there are few other hotels in this area. The smoking situation is troubling as I do not smoke and the hotel seems to be a smokers' paradise. And oh yes, there is free wi-fi (very nice) and a business center for printing documents (no charge). Their restaurant was a bit shaky (hardly anyone eating there) so, to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LaurelG15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a wedding at the Capitol Theatre and would highly recommende it for anyone else doing the same - it is (I think) the hotel nearest the theatre. The rooms are big - much bigger than I expected - the hotel is clean and the service friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Friendlyface097
Reviews.Content: It is not often I stay in a Downtown hotel on a private visit. I did have to do so while attending a wedding. This hotel had a good service, valet parking and is very central. The rate was $120 a night and did not include breakfast. Rooms were huge, something we dont get in Europe. All rooms were with 2 Double beds and can easily sleep a family of 4. Beds were very comfortable. Will go back. Breakfast was $12.00 per head. It was an avergae breakfast but good value for money. I stayed one night, the shampoo, soaps were below standard.. Please take your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in north Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JMAChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, and found much to enjoy. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was reasonably spacious, and clean. (The rubber mat for the bathtub was old and grungy, though. It should have been retired a year ago.) There was no microwave, although there was a refridge. The wi-fi internet connection in the room worked well, which is more than I can say for many hotels. The staff that we had brief contact with were friendly. The biggest drawback to this hotel are the extra charges, which aren't very well advertised on its website. First and foremost, the only hotel parking is valet parking, and costs $14 plus tax, so nearly $16, per night. If you look for parking information with tenacity, you'll find that the hotel's website mentions the $14 parking fee, and mentions a municipal lot about a block away. We didn't realize there was a municipal lot, but you might want to check it out. The other extra charge would be for breakfast: $8 per person for a continental breakfast and roughly $12 per person for the hot breakfast. There are several coffeeshops within two blocks, so if you want only a light breakfast, you would do better to eat at one of those, which is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, WONDERFUL SERVICES”
Reviews.Author: dicrom88
Reviews.Content: After looking at many Toronto downtown hotels on the Internet, with very poor reviews, we chose the Roehampton Best Western which is about 25 mins. by bus & subway from city centre. We cannot fault the very spacious rooms with fridge and the excellent daily servicing. Also a free internet room is available as well as free local calls, which is a real plus ! Having previous lived in Toronto for many years, this city has now become very expensive to eat out so the fridge (and anticipated microwave) in the hotel room will be a definite asset. This is a great hotel, extremely quiet on higher floors, and we enjoyed our week's stay there very much. Many thanks !

Reviews.Title: “Great room, odd staff”
Reviews.Author: dior17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after attending a wedding on October 7th. The room was huge and clean even thought we were given 2 double beds and not a king as requested. Since we arrived back to our room at 2am we were tired. We did not notice that we had slept in a little (11:15) we then recieved a phone call asking if we were ready to leave yet. I am aware that we were late starting but it was rude to ask "When are you leaving". We quickly got ready and exited the room. We enter the hallway and the cleaners and what looked to be a supervisor were outside. I was carrying a beautiful centerpiece from the wedding and the supervisor stopped and stared at me then RAN into the room where the cleaners were. I assume that she suspected that I might have been trying to steal a floral arrangement from the room and went to ask the others. The don't have fresh arrangements with 2 dozen red roses in their rooms! Overall it was very good. Too bad we woke up too late to enjoy the Saturday breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious, spacious and a great location”
Reviews.Author: jimweibo
Reviews.Content: Some of our Toronto friends get a bit sniffy when we tell them we are staying at this hotel. Well, this was our fourth or fifth visit and we fully intend to return again in the future. The room we had on this occasion was huge and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was the smallest you're likely to find outside a cruise ship, but perfectly adequate. The location is good -- ten minutes brisk walk from the nearest subway, in a really interesting upscale neighbourhood. Staff are friendly -- the same three or four guys have been parking the cars for at least the last decade! We did not sample the breakfast -- there are plenty of coffee shops nearby -- but it looks like good value. Toronto is becoming a very expensive city; a stay at this very agreeable hotel is a good way of saving some money next time you visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: CRS111
Reviews.Content: Due to the Toronto International Film Festival, we could not find any accommodation in the downtown area at a reasonable price and opted to stay out of town at the Best Western Roehampton for a couple of nights at the end of our two week stay in Toronto. The room we had (616) was extremely nice, with large flat screen television, iPhone/iPod docking station, very very comfortable beds, a great shower, free Wifi and a coffee-maker. Elsewhere in the hotel was a fitness center and small outdoor swimming pool. The hotel reception area was also very nice and we found the reception staff to be pleasant and helpful. I think the area which the hotel is in may be classed as Midtown, anyway it was around a ten minute walk to Eglington subway station, with very frequent trains to Downtown, on the same line as Dundas (for Eaton Centre/Dundas Square) and Union (for Union Station). We walked to the downtown once as well which took around an hour. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was nice, and could be bought for a reasonable $12 if not included with your room. I would highly recommend the hotel if you are staying in the area, or if you cannot get a good rate in Downtown. I was very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “1 star dump in good location”
Reviews.Author: mgolf27
Reviews.Content: had a reservation 9/23 arrived at 900 pm only room left a smoking room next to the elevator went to check room this roomSTANK of cigars/ cigarettes Body Odor We asked for a refund ( Award reservation() but hotel wouldnt try we left stayed at the Hilton downtown which a 5 star experience Stay anywhere else in toronto

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for cheaper price than hotels located closer to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: ninec
Reviews.Content: Searching for a reasonably priced hotel during TIFF was a nightmare. Thankfully this hotel didn't double their room rates and was located close to the Eglinton subway. It was really convenient to obtain a day pass ($10 for unlimited travel for a family if purchased for a Saturday or Sunday) at the Mac's store across the street, then take the bus to Yonge St and grab the subway. Some days we just walked to Yonge as it's not that far really. Right outside the hotel is a Second Cup which was great for my morning java fix. The hotel room is dated. The carpet and tiles could really use replacing. Thank goodness the beds were a clean, crisp white - flat screen tv, too. We only used the room to sleep, and shower, so it was okay. My room was #416 and it didn't have air conditioning controls. We were comfortable, but others may like to be able to control the temperature) The view from this room is HORRIBLE!!! ...can't see a thing and it looks out over air exchange units or whatever they are. The curtains were drawn the entire stay. I would've given an "Excellent" for service if it wasn't for the afternoon staff (women) at the front desk. I had asked for an extra writing pad and at first they had no idea what I meant, then told me they didn't have any and went about their business (gabbing). It really felt rude, as I was made to feel like I was bothering them. They could've directed me to where I could've obtained one (cleaning staff) or tried to get paper for me. I have to stress that when checking in on the Friday (day time, Sept. 9th), the front desk staff (women) were very polite and gave excellent service. The cleaning staff rocked - very polite, and helpful. **Note: An excellent place for pizza is just up the road and around the corner on Yonge St called Classico. Their pizza slices were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a very good area”
Reviews.Author: tigersfan23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice since I moved away from TO about a year ago and both times I have been very pleased. The rooms are a very good size and, at least from the ones I have been in, well laid out and clean. The second time I stayed there was a little bit more noise then the time before, but nothing too distracting. I really didn't use many of the amenities, as I really just used the hotel as a base for my time in TO. I previously lived in the area of the hotel (Yonge and Eglinton) and being honest, this area is an awesome place to visit/live. From the hotel, the subway at Eglinton station (trip from this station to downtown is about 10 mins) is about 4 blocks west and at the Yonge-Eglinton corner there is a small mall. Also, the area has alot of great places to eat, especially along Yonge St. Bringing this all together, you get a very good hotel in an excellent area. I found the rates very reasonable and the staff very friendly and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: murt4
Reviews.Content: absolutely horrible stay at the hotel i was staying with my partner my brother 10 year old niece and 2 young children my daughter aged 2 and my 8 month old son not only were the staff rude and unhelpful upon arrival we had been in our rooms 15 mins after an 8 hour flight when i was called and rudely told to keep the noise down i let it slide and after tended to take the children for walks so i didnt get any more complaints which resulted in me and my partner walking the streets of toronto in the early hours of the mornings for the whole holiday , on the second day the maid was rude as i walked into the room and told me she had to change the sheets as they was dirty i may be crazy but i thought that was their job so i apoligised and went on with my day , the next day i was in the next room where my brother was staying and over heard the maids complaining about cleaning so i took it up with the manager who was most unhelpfull ,we went on with our holiday and tried to stay away from the hotel as much as possible on the weekend before we left we stayed the weekend at niagra falls when we arrived back we was called by the genral manager about a matter he wanted to speak to us about so i went down to speak with him he claimed we had ruined bed sheets i tried to explain we hadnt stayed at the hotel the night they was saying it happened and was not only spoken to rudely by him he also said he would not speak to me as i was a woman and threatened to make my life hell and charge everything he could to the credit card and also threatened to call the police on me i said that was abit extreme we left the hotel as i was so worried what he might do i didnt want my children in there i rang head office who was no help what so ever he refused to refund the last night of the stay so we could go to a different hotel ,he then made up complete lies about what we had said told head office we had ten unaccounted for guests in the room seeing as i have never been to canada before i dont know where i would have found people to stay with us he said we had refused house keeping and wouldnt let them into our room when i asked the maid she said she had cleaned the room everyday completely contradicted theirselves when i brought this to their attention they then once again refused to speak to me , we had no choice but to go back as he eventually said he would refund the last night but charge charge us $350 we went back and stayed the night but didnt get much sleep as i was so worried as to what he might do , i woke early packed our bags then met my sister in law who lives local in reception to try and clear up the matter where we was met with a host of lies agressive managers and total disrespect i asked the manager to come to the room as they was trying to say we had damaged the mattress and was going to charge us for it he refused to come i just wanted piece of mind so asked him to sign a piece of paper he eventually agreed to come to the room where he said the matress was fine but still refused to sign anything , i think its appauling people think they can treat their guests like this , we checked out this morning and will never go back once i return home i will be taking matters further they have completely ruined our holiday very very dissapointed ,

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel on outskirts of City centre”
Reviews.Author: seeker21
Reviews.Content: Restaurant not open every day, no bar but lots os pubs and restaurantss close by Comfy beds and rooms have all facilities. Good value

Reviews.Title: “'Excellent Location. Value for the rate"”
Reviews.Author: kishchatt
Reviews.Content: Have been on the road for a few weeks as was doing NYC then staying at hotels on way till we reached Roehampton. A group of 5 friends from Jamaica visiting Canada for the first time; found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. We checked at 11am. Even though all all the rooms were not available, we were given one room to throw in our bags & freshen up before we headed out for Lunch. Houskeeping staff were nice enough to bring some extra towels for the rest of the ppl in our group. Upon our return, we found fresh towels. Thank you team, for accomodating us & for your hospitality. We sure will suggest your hotel to our friends visiting Toronto. ( Which we often have due to direct flights now) Keep up the great work. We definatley couldnt have asked for more than we received. We got a great rate via Hote wire & the accomodation did justice to the rate we paid. We shall be back next yr.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel with unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SomeGuy1027
Reviews.Content: I was in town for three weeks for business meetings with a team of about 20 colleagues and we booked this hotel because its location was convenient to our meetings. Upon arrival we found the rooms to be dirty (stains on sheets furniture and carpet, I just didn't want to touch anything), very outdated, and with a slight odor. On top of that the staff were very discourteous. I believe one of the other reviewers described them aptly as "abrupt". It was as if we were inconveniencing them by staying in their hotel. So we cancelled our reservations so as not to bother them anymore and spent the following two weeks at the Westin Prince which was MUCH nicer and only about $10 a night more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C”
Reviews.Author: Sweetie21119
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our sister in Toronto for the weekend as it was here bday and she did not have enough room for us so we thought we would stay close. The BW Roehampton is located at Mt. Plesant and Eg so it was great. When we arrived there was only one person working on the desk and the other was out smoking (which we could see) We could only get a smoking room (which was not ideal, but we were only sleeping there so it was fine) We are all non-smokers and although the room smelt horribly like smoke that was ok, but the air circulation was disgusting. It was like we were in the Caribbean with no sun. It was soooo hot in the room, it was awful to sleep. We only slept for 3 hours because we wanted to get out of there very fast in the morning. For a hotel that welcomes tourists, business people and locals on a daily basis, this basic need should be fixed. Will probably stay downtown for the extra $50 to ensure I have the basic services.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service- WHAT Customer Service??”
Reviews.Author: MMMISSY
Reviews.Content: The stay probably would have been more enjoyable providing the front desk staff were not so abrupt, disrespectful, and outright rude. There was ZERO sense of customer service, and they even had the nerve to roll their eyes, talk about my partner and I when they thought we couldn't hear (we were in the business centre), and even turn away from us when we were making requests. When asking for the general manager I wasn't given a name. When asking for the general manager's business card it was "non-existent." When asking for the general manager's e-mail- they told me to call and ask for it myself on a later date as they were not in. Go ahead- stay at the Roehampton, but dare to request ANYTHING from the front desk staff- ESPECIALLY an early check-in. But don't even bother with the general manager- he or she is completely supportive of their horrible staff. Good for nothing but a headache.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: PVfirst
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights. I had booked a room with two double beds. It was big enough, had a desk, TV, a refrigerator, coffee maker. Free Wifi was a definite plus. The room was a bit dated but clean. The service was good, the bed comfortable and the shower great. My room was toward the back and I slept with the window open; I heard no traffic noise. The hotel is perfectly located, within a minute to buses and a couple of minutes to the subway. It took 25 minutes to get to Young and Queen (Bus and Subway). Unfortunately, breakfast is not included and after reading the reviews i did not feel like trying it. A Second Cup (with great coffee) is right at the corner. It was a good experience and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of anything bad to say!”
Reviews.Author: NoCoastPunk
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, awesome location. Minutes from the Yonge transit line, close to shopping, food, downtown, everything. This was a great choice as a hotel for this trip. Parking is valet only, this was the only negative aspect. I didn't even need my car though because everything was close and I use transit regularly. WiFi was a bit slow...but I think the hotel was crowded and the bandwidth was maxed out. Pool was outdoors and closed. The walls were pretty thin, but I enjoyed the "audio entertainment" I received from my next door neighbors so it didn't bother me (wish it happened more often!). Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what do u mean the heat can't be turned turned on!? its almost october!”
Reviews.Author: Unsatisfied_Person
Reviews.Content: The Roehampton Best Western is the most un-organized/un-professional hotel i've ever stayed at. I drove 5 and a half hours to get here and when i get here, i find out they didn't make the reservations for the first of two days i was supposed to be staying. secondly, i was FREEZING in my room!!! i called down to the front desk, nobody would answer my call. ITS ONLY 8pm, pick up the phone!!! so after trying to call the desk 5 or 6 times and receiving no answer, i went down to see if anyone was even here... both desks down stairs had staff using the phone for personal calls! no wonder i couldn't get through!!! as soon as i got off the elevator, both guys at the desk lept off the phones and computers to serve me... FINALLY!! only to find out that the hotel only has a/c, and the heat wont be turned on... wont be turned on!? its almost october! there's frost on the ground at night!! Disappointed in the staff, i returned to my room, cold and pissed off! So after i get back to my room and settle down at about 8:30pm i called for room service. This time i actually get an answer! But i find out that the kitchen closes at 9pm and there is only one person to cook, clean and deliver the food... so the staff advised me that she would call me back in my room when she had time... Needless to say i didn't get any food untill 9:30!!! WHAT KIND OF HOTEL DOESN'T HAVE ROOM SERVICE AFTER 9!? NOT EVERYONE SHOWS UP AT NOON TO CHECK IN! I was SO upset with my stay, i was ready to cancel the meeting i was supposed to goto and leave for home that night!!! I would not advise anybody to stay here. the staff is very unprofessional. the rooms aren't very nice (especially compared to the lobby). The rooms lack heat and they are TINY!!!!! -unsatisfied customer

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for exploring Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SummerDriver
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a perfect stop. We stayed outside of downtown to save $ (everything in the area is relatively pricey). Initially I thought staying so far from town would be an inconvenience, but it was not at all. It was great not having to take the car into the horrendous downtown traffic! The subway was maybe a 15-minute walk from the hotel, and then a 15-minute subway ride to downtown -- very easy. We did the walk to the subway station several times in our two days as we explored the area. Lots of restaurants and businesses within walking distance of hotel. The room was very large and comfortable -- no complaints whatsoever. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NealB
Reviews.Content: Our suite was huge and just right for our family. Room was very clean, breakfast was great and the staff was friendly. Nice location a little bit away from downtown but in a vibrant neighborhood with restaurants and supermarkets. Great place to stay in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again; great location.”
Reviews.Author: glanzerr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Toronto for a friend's wedding, and spent two nights at the Roehampton Inn. I chose it at random on Priceline without doing much research because I had only a few minutes left to use a $30 voucher. I booked a non-smoking room with one king bed, but when we arrived to the hotel they had us down for a smoking room with two queen beds. We didn't arrive until 2am, so we took the room we were given and didn't complain and went directly to bed. We woke up in the morning very refreshed. The room was nice and cool and the beds were comfortable. I'm 6'7" so my feet were hanging off the end of the bed, but that's to be expected in most hotels. We skipped the $15 breakfast buffet, which seemed like nothing more than a typical free continental breakfast. The walking distance to the subway was just a few short blocks and we were able to get downtown easily. We didn't use the pool, and didn't dirty the room enough to even bother having housekeeping clean up after us during the day, so I can't say much else about the hotel. The parking lot is totally run by the in-house valet, which I guess was convenient. We tipped the valet a few dollars for a job well done as he helped us with our luggage. We used the business center (1 computer with a printer) to print a parking document and had no troubles. I am fairly certain I'd stay here again next time we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, good rooms, great staff :)”
Reviews.Author: travelbugcheri
Reviews.Content: Got this Hotel Room through Hotwire. It was rated as a 3 star. *I will make some negative comments regarding hotwire at the end of this review which has no connection to the stay or services I received at this hotel* This hotel is located in a residential area, but just off a main street (Eglinton/Mt Pleasant) I would recommend this for someone wanting to see the sites of Toronto, or even doing business/working downtown since it's a nice 10 minute walk or 3 minutes bus ride to the subway and Yonge Street. There are plenty of restaurants, coffee shops and retail stores in the area at various price points. It's out of the tourist/business area, nice to go for walks, meet people, etc. Arrived and the lobby had more like a boutique(y) feel to it. Check in was seamless. Pleasant and helpful front desk staff. The whole process took about 3 minutes. Was given a room on the 3rd floor. Close to fitness room and pool. Nice room, and it was spotless! 2 comfortable beds, with great linen (sheets and towels) A nice view (facing North) Mini fridge, coffee maker, shampoo, lotion, shower cap, soap etc. It was a good sized room. Despite being on the same floor as the pool/fitness area it was super quiet. never really heard anything outside the room. Concierge was helpful, and suggested an all day breakfast restaurant just around the corner, $3.99 for a great breakfast! I believe the hotels breakfast was $8, I didn't go for it though. Parking- I found parking a couple blocks north in the residential part (this will only work on the weekends as it was posted no parking Mon-Fri 830am-430pm and I know the parking patrol in that area is ruthless) If it would have been a weekday I would have parked at the hotel as public lots for 24hrs would probably be more than the $14 the valet wanted. I live in Toronto, but if I didn't, I would stay here during visits due the location/comfort/price. It's rated a 3 star and I would agree. If you're looking for a luxury hotel it's not quite there, but I think it exceeds the standards set for " Best Westerns" HOTWIRE- I mention this because 1) Perhaps the hotel needs to be aware of what this company is doing to people 2) I did not find a review on this site for hotwire and I think there should be given my experience and the number of sour ones I have found in the past few days online) 3) I'm ticked The reason I booked this weekend in the first place was because I was attending an event and I wanted to be close to the venue. When I booked the 3 Star promised to be 0.9 miles from the venue it was 15 google map miles (not even in the same city. I asked for Vaughn ON and this hotel is in mid-town Toronto) When I called the company to find out what happened they told me it was 0.9 miles in a straight line via air travel!! There was no reasoning with this company. They refused to give a refund or rebook for me. They actually wanted to have me book something in the original area I wanted at a higher price AND they would give me a credit for a future stay somewhere else. I told them not only would I not be spending anymore money with them but I would also be relaying my experience to friends/family. In a nutshell, don't book through Hotwire if you are looking for a specific area. They lie. I don't know if they have always been like that or if they have just gotten too big and don't care anymore. I had used them in the past without incident, but never really needed a specific location. Lesson learned :)

Reviews.Title: “Decen hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsMonica
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I attended a conference in Toronto and decided to stay here. While its a 15 minute cab ride away from downtown where most trade conference happen, its in a decent location with lots of shops around. Good, clean room. Helpful concierge. Cute little breakfast lounge. I recommend it to anyone visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “valet parking damaged my vehicle”
Reviews.Author: 1EXECUTIVE
Reviews.Content: We have no choice but leave our vehicle with valet parking. When I picked up my car, the valet driving it sped to front door and slammed on the breaks. I walked towards the back of my car to put the luggage in and did not notice the front end was scratched. My car appears to have it a concreate barrier. My 1 month old vehicle is all scratched and hotel management won't do anything about it. The food is also horrible at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: prudenttrav
Reviews.Content: We ended up in BW Roehampton after having had to cancel a reservation with HI Express in North York (HI hotel had no cribs!) and were pleasantly surprised. We had a clean, small but cozy room with 2 double beds and nice city view. The hotel lobby had nice hip decor and the staff were very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Some things old, some things new”
Reviews.Author: 457khz
Reviews.Content: The BW Roehampton wasn't my first choice, but since availability downtown was extremely limited (Film Fest) I ended up here. Not being overly familiar with Toronto, I was initially put off by the perceived location when I looked at a map. After arrival, I found that downtown was very accessible (10 min walk down the street to Eglinton/Yonge subway, $2.75 and another 10 minutes or so.) I found the hotel itself to be more average than anything... The room I was in (10th/top floor) was very large, but had an odd configuration. A partial renovation seems to have occurred recently in that there was a new flat screen TV which conveniently swiveled to point at either the beds or work desk/couch, new bed sheets, and a VERY comfortable bed. There also was a handy bar fridge in the room. The bathroom was my least favourite attribute of the room... It was tiny and cramped, with an old school heat lamp that was turned on with the fan giving a red glow to the room. If they were to do a full reno of the room, I'd have them pull out a few walls and make the bathroom bigger. I never did try the restaurant, even though I was given daily 10% off coupons by the front desk as check-in. The decor looked quite tired and spartan, and I found a number of good options in the surrounding area (and in downtown Toronto). Never tried room service either as was available only during the hours the restaurant was operating. Internet access (wi-fi only) was fast, and FREE. Only minor annoyance is that it would periodically timeout and you'd be redirected to the hotel login/splash screen now and then. Overall, this is a decent hotel for a good price. For me, I would have preferred to stay a little closer into the downtown core and likely will next time I'm in town. If you need to be in this area of Toronto (or want to save a few bucks), I think it'd be a good option.

Reviews.Title: “IT JUST GOT BETTER AND BETTER”
Reviews.Author: emyaisbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed on three occasions in August. The rooms were in the top half of the hotel and were spacious, well-appointed, quiet and the beds comfortable. The staff were friendly, available and attentive. Breakfast was Ã -la-carte and reasonably priced. The location is very good - a 10-minute walk to the Yonge & Eglinton metro (a three minute bus ride if preferred - with a frequent service just outside the hotel). I have taken home good memories - due in no small part to the excellent stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you need to be in Yonge/Eglinton area”
Reviews.Author: efex66
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay a night in a hotel due to emergency repair service on our home (water pipe damage), which is located relatively in the same area (we still had to drive to get there). We arrived quite late -12AM and booked the reservation through the best western website. Cost was $120 per night + taxes (what the hell is a marketing distribution fee charge???) + valet parking (though we really parked ourselves $12 +tip) = around $150 - wow for that price I could stay downtown, but if you're in a bind.... Although the room was nice & clean, and I guess after experiencing water damage in our home this was a godsend, there's really not much else to like. We were on the third floor - room 302 - and it was most likely the worst view in the whole hotel. I woke up to the "whirring" of the air conditioner or some sort of ventilation machine outside the window. The carpet, tv, wardrobe, fridge, coffee maker, bathtub and curtains were quite dated though I agree with the other posters that the bed and linens have been updated and was quite comfortable. So what I'm left with is a comfortable bed and a decent if dated bathroom - is that worth $150, HMMMMM... What sealed the deal that this hotel is clearly lacking is the customer service and restaurant service (room service is not 24 hours and breakfast only begins at 7AM - and why isn't this free???). Poor customer service at the front desk for checking us into the worst view room and recommending Pizza Pizza as the only place open in the area for food. Just up the street was 24 hours Golden Griddle - please go there for breakfast, etc. instead. Lastly, on check out, the person was more interested in talking on the phone than taking care of my check out. Will not go to this hotel again - not even if my house burned down! PS > there is no swimming pool as the hotel renovating this, which is on the third floor. thus if you want wake up after 8AM, don't expect to sleep in. LESSON - DON'T STAY ON THE THIRD FLOOR AND DEFINITELY NOT ROOM 302!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better hotel than the dated exterior suggests”
Reviews.Author: lopar
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel since it was a short walk from a friend we were visiting for 3 nights. I've only stayed at one Best Western before, in Sedona, so didn't really know what this one would be like. The hotel is a bit dated, but the room had obviously been recently renovated and therefore had a lovely bed, and flat screen tv. The hotel was full and we were initially offered only a smoking room, which smelt horrible and looked scruffy. Thankfully another was found after some digging by a lovely receptionist. All the staff were really friendly, and even though we weren't in the hotel much they made a difference to our stay. Had a room service breakfast of pancakes the first morning ,which was far better than I expected. There is a second cup coffee shop just steps from the hotel, which became a regular stop each morning for an iced coffee to stem the 90 degree heat! The subway is also only a few minutes walk away, and we managed to catch a bus back to just outside the hotel several times. It's a good location for getting quickly downtown and there are loads of bars and restaurants a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, comfortable, and clean”
Reviews.Author: ThetaSigma99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while I was attending a workshop nearby. The rooms were clean and comfortable, though oddly designed. I was in a one-bedroom suite. The living room had a couch, but no TV. The only TV was in the bedroom. It also took a bit of creativity to get the curtain not to allow a stream of light in every morning that conveniently hit exactly where the pillows were. The free WiFi was awesome, though it is a bit aggressive in making you sign in again after 20 minutes of inactivity. The breakfast was nothing special, but it was a buffet and it was surprisingly cheap. (They give you 15% off coupons at check-in). After the discount, the breakfast cost a bit over $10 CAD. I was usually one of the only people in the hotel restaurant. The fitness center was tiny (I swear the photo on the website looked bigger), but it was fine. The pool is currently closed for renovation. The one real irritation at this hotel is that their keycard system doesn't work very well. I was not the only one ot stand outside their hotel door trying to get the reader to acknowledge my room key. I heard another person down the hall complaining that this always happens at this hotel. So that's really the biggest annoyance. Other than that, the hotel was well-situated for my workshop, and it was a block or two away from tons of shops and restaurants and everything.

Reviews.Title: “a great room!”
Reviews.Author: Billyp27
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed because of the location, so we could see the downtown without the high price of downtown hotel. The check in was a little sketchy because of the "forced" valet parking. They have very limited parking but was not a real issue. The check in was quick and getting off the elevator onto the 9th floor was a trip into a dated decor that reminded me of the american southwest, except no cactus or sagebrush. The room was very spacious, the bathroom roomy and clean. The beds and linens must have just been replaced, because they were 5 star hotel beds. It was the best sleep i had in a hotel in a very long time. The business center featured a dilapitated monitor that badly needs to be replaced but was compensated by a great connection that one would wish in every hotel! Based on the room itself i would come back again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: decil76
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel to stay in for one night during our stay in Toronto. I picked this one because it's near the science center and not too far from the subway. I wanted to minimize city driving and parking. When we checked in, I wanted to ask some questions at the desk, but the lady didn't seem to understand English very well. My first question got lost in translation (maybe I didn't ask it right) and I gave up on any other questions. The lady at the front desk when we checked out was very nice, however. The room was fine with a decent view of the city. The beds were above average. The pool was small and 4 foot 6 throughout, so not much good for anything - too small to swim in and too deep for kids to play in. The walk to the subway was a little farther then I expected - I think it took us 10 minutes or so. That was fine - we enjoy walking - except when we were in a hurry to get downtown. I have no complaints about this hotel, though not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good three star hotel with very good restaurant in the surround”
Reviews.Author: LimburgerBelgium
Reviews.Content: Good three star hotel. Willing staf to help you and change your room if there are some problems. Breakfast can better. In the surround of 500 m a very fine italian restaurant the Piatti Eglinton Ave. SUPER !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: yellowrosy
Reviews.Content: Ok, when we first got there it was fine, average looking hotel, nice looking room...But then it started going downhill! They could never provide for anything we asked for at the front desk, even though they claimed to have it in their Best Western Welcome booklet...the bed had a huge dip in the middle, it was the most uncomfortable bed we've ever slept in, they did not have any flat pillows, sleeping on their pillows felt like sleeping on rectangular shaped balloons, we didn't sleep that night. Their "buffet" breakfast was basically a continental breakfast which most hotels give you for free, but best western charges $8 for it, so we ate at the Pickle Barrel. We had booked for 2 nights, but we didn't even bother sleeping there the 2nd night, the front desk didn't even care to ask us why we weren't staying the 2nd night, they were just happy that they could charge us for it...Never staying there again...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: colonelveran
Reviews.Content: this hotel is underrated. i've stayed here one week for business in sept. i have many good things to say; the rooms are clean and large, decent size bathroom, fridge and coffee maker, nice pool, good location, good restaurants around, friendly staff etc etc. the bad parts were: noise from the a/c outside the room, somewhere on the lower level roof, there is a whole lot of them and they make a noise like a factory. wasn't so bad though with the windows closed but it's noticeable. another thing is the noise coming from the a/c in the room. it's a little too noisy, i think. another thing is valet parking. although the staff is quick, it could take a few minutes to get your car and you don't have access to it when you need it. i like self-parking, it gives you full access to your car when you need it. overall the hotel was very good, i had a pleasant stay and i recommend it. get a room on the upper floors and away from the a/c units and you'll be fine. i really like here, the service was good and i would come back. i used to stay at the days hotel on carlton but this a much better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: LufTravel
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for 1 night for a conference booked by my office. Bed was like sleeping on a rock, room was run down, the wind howled through the windows, the bellman was the rudest individual in the world. The only plus was the nice front desk attendants. Stay somewhere else if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: mcayce
Reviews.Content: Having lived in this area of Toronto from 1979 to 1989 I can honestly say that this is the best kept secret in the city. The hotel is located in an upper-middle class area that during the 1980's was the Yuppy Capital of Canada. Fortunately, when I returned in September for the Film Festival, all of the negative things associated with that era were gone, while all of the positive things remained. This really is a charming area. You can walk to the subway in eight minutes and be downtown in another twelve to fifteen minutes. If you miss the last subway or want to pamper yourself a little, it is only fifteen dollars by cab. Do not eat breakfast in the hotel dining room. There are at least fifty great places to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner within a ten minute walk of the hotel. For breakfast, there are dozens of places on Eglinton Ave. walking towards Yonge Street. There are also lots of places at Yonge & Eglinton, the nearest major crossroads and location of the Subway station. On Saturday and Sunday Mornings I would recommend Breakfast at one of the local British or Irish Pubs. It sounds strange, but they have great Steak and Eggs for around seven dollars and bottomless cups of coffee. For Dinner, I would recommend another of Toronto's best kept secrets. Walk down Mount Pleasant Road and you will find ten to fifteen of the finest, coziest restaurants in the city. You can choose from prices ranging from reasonable to very expensive. The food and wines at the very expensive restaurants are expensive but not overpriced. One last thing, while you are staying in that area, take a walk down one or two of the neighborhood streets such as Roehampton or Soudan. There are two funky old movie theaters in the neighborhood that still show movies on a daily basis and go back to the 1920's. There are two High Schools that go back to the 20's and several churches that go back to the 1800's, yet it is still one of the hippest areas in Toronto. This would be a great place to stay for couples or families. Since you can still get downtown to all the major attractions in a matter of minutes, this really is the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Best Western”
Reviews.Author: KristinY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at here for three nights in September 2004 and are planning on going back at the end of April. I honestly cannot understand where the negative reviews are coming from. We arrived late at the hotel and the staff was super about getting us checked into our room quickly. I loved the rooms, we had a huge king sized bed which was absolutely to die for. It was extremely comfortable. We had numerous pillows both on the bed and in the closet. Our room was extremely clean and there were no stains on our bed as another person said. Granted the parking lot was small and poorly designed it did not matter as someone parked your car for you and brought it to the door when you wanted to leave. The location of the hotel was great. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We only ate breakfast at the hotel. Breakfast was a buffet style and it was overpriced for what you got. Despite the fact that I was not thrilled with breakfast it didn't matter because you were so close to other resturants. Overall, I had a fabulous stay and look forward to returning at the end of April.

Reviews.Title: “Excllent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why people complained here. I had an excellent time at this hotel. The room was clean, and great... parking was great. I was on a business trip and had my laptop w/ wireless card ... and the *free* high speed internet access was amazingly fast. I would highly recommend it. It was pretty close too all the things I need to get too... and the price was better than staying downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Value With Some Warts++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Parrot434
Reviews.Content: After giving up on downtown hotels (due to price or funky locations), we settled on this Best Western. To our surprise, the location is outstanding. You are within walking distance (or a short bus ride) to many interesting and affordable restaurants for breakfast, lunch, dinner or snacks. The neighborhood is bustling with young professionals and hip singles along with enough retail to cover any buying need. The Eglinton Subway is just five blocks away and very safe and the bus stop is just feet away. You can get to any downtown location in 20 minutes or less. Or just enjoy the neighborhood you are in! Our standard Queen Bed room was affordable and decent in terms of decor and cleanliness. The hotel is a little old but rennovation and remodeling have brought it up to speed. It's accurately rated at three stars out of five. With that said, there are two main flaws: forget about the dining room and room service. Breakfast service was horrendous (due to understaffing) although the front desk people tried to make up for it. Your best bet is walking one or two blocks to several decent breakfast type places - the best being the Golden Griddle. Coffee and sandwich places abound. The other flaw is parking. I can see why they charge an exhorbarant rate of $12 per day for a lot that should cost no more than $4 per day. The lot is poorly designed and going in/out requires driving through a lane one car-length wide. If someone is pulling up to the unload luggage, forgot about coming in or going out. This is why the use of a Valet is necessary to move cars and coordinate traffic and unloading. Otherwise, there would be parking lot rage! Bottom line - a very good choice unless you are looking for pure luxury or want to be a dead in the middle of the downtown, financial, theatre or harbourfront areas and despise public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is got to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! The front desk checked me in to a room that had other people in it. Ok mistakes happen but when they gave me another room same thing. Then they told me that they are sorry and they only have smoking rooms left. Thanks but no thanks.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Roehampton Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 808 Mount Pleasant Road, Toronto, Ontario M4P 2L2, Canada
